question_text: Why can parity memory fail to detect certain types of errors?
answer_options: It does not include a parity bit with stored bytes
It only checks for even parity, missing multi-bit errors
It attempts to correct errors instead of halting the system
It is incompatible with ECC systems
correct_answer: It only checks for even parity, missing multi-bit errors
explanation: Parity memory uses a single parity bit for each byte, allowing detection of some errors but not allâ€”especially if multiple bits are affected.
